It seems you're turning getnetworkinfo into something that returns information about all peers. That's not correct. fRelayTxs is a per-peer variable, so if you want to expose it, it will go in getpeerinfo which lists information over all peers.\n

@dragongem45 Please squash your commits:

``` sh
git clone https://github.com/dragongem45/bitcoinclassic.git bitcoin
cd bitcoin
git fetch --all
git checkout patch-2
git rebase --interactive ea4c315~
[Select "f" for all lines but the first]
git push origin patch-2 -f
```

The `relaytxes` field in getnetworkinfo now reports whether we have at least one peer which has the fRelayTxs flag set. Wouldn't it be more logical to put it in getpeerinfo, where it gets reported for every peer individually?\n

> The relaytxes field in getnetworkinfo now reports whether we have at least one peer which has the fRelayTxs flag set. Wouldn't it be more logical to put it in getpeerinfo, where it gets reported for every peer individually?\n\nI think it's not implemented correctly. The original idea behind exposing this on the interface is so that applications know whether _we_ relay transactions. So what value

@dragongem45 Are you still working on this?

Please remove this diff and squash your commits.
